title: 114_hr2591
content: The "Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund Act of 2015" allows for contributions to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund through an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Individuals can designate a portion of their tax overpayment (minimum $1) to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund and make additional contributions to the Fund. This can be done when filing tax returns or at a later time specified by the Secretary. Individuals can designate a portion of their tax overpayment to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund as prescribed by the Secretary. The designation can be made when filing tax returns or at a later time. The overpayment designated shall be treated as refunded to the taxpayer and a contribution to the United States. The United States amends the Internal Revenue Code to create the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. The United States creates the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund under SEC. 9512. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to provide services to homeless veterans through the Department of Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service, and Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund aims to prevent and end veteran homelessness by supporting programs administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service, and Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can transfer funds to these departments for programs serving homeless veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, must provide a detailed expenditure plan for the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund to the relevant committees 60 days before any expenditure. Starting from the President's annual budget submission for fiscal year 2017, the Departments of Veterans Affairs, Labor, and Housing and Urban Development must report on the previous year's fund usage and propose the next year's fund allocation. The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding a new item for the next fiscal year's funds. The table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new item for the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund, effective for taxable years after the enactment of this Act.
